IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROVIDE HIGHER EDUCATION PROGRAMS WHICH MEET THE INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF STUDENTS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF MOUNT ALOYSIUS COLLEGE IS TO RESPOND TO INDIVIDUAL AND COMMUNITY NEEDS WITH QUALITY PROGRAMS OF EDUCATION IN THE TRADITION OF THE RELIGIOUS SISTERS OF MERCY. EACH STUDENT WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO ACQUIRE KNOWLEDGE AND TO DEVELOP VALUES, ATTITUDES, AND COMPETENCIES NECESSARY FOR LIFELONG LEARNING WITHIN AN ENVIRONMENT WHICH REFLECTS A LIBERAL ARTS ORIENTATION AND A CATHOLIC, JUDEO-CHRISTIAN HERITAGE.
IRS990.Description: Accredited by Middle States Commission on Higher Education, Mount Aloysius College offers undergraduate degrees in a broad variety of subjects, including Health Sciences, Business, General Studies, and Liberal Arts. It also offers five graduate programs and an accelerated Bachelor's degree program for adults. The College provides Library and other academic support services, which includes making computers available to students.

Activity2.Description: Mount Aloysius College strives to develop students, both inside and outside the classroom. Student services plays an important role in the development of physical, mental, and social well-being. The College offers both a NCAA Division III athletic program and an active intramural program. Health and counseling centers assist students in need, and provide an opportunity for students to better themselves. Active Club and student activities programs promote a strong sense of community on the campus.

Activity3.Description: Mount Aloysius College maintains five residence halls and a house, along with centralized dining services, for students. A full service Bookstore is also available for student use.

ActivityOther.Description: THE COLLEGE PROVIDES ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES TO STAFF AND STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: PAID CONSULTANTS TO MEET WITH LEGISLATIVE REPRESENTATIVES.

OtherLiabilities.Description: ADVANCE FROM FEDERAL GOVERNMENT FOR STUDENT LOANS

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE COLLEGE HOUSES A SMALL ART COLLECTION WHICH IS ON PUBLIC DISPLAY AS WELL AS BEING USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES BY ART DEPARTMENT FACULTY. THE COLLEGE ALSO MAINTAINS A SMALL RELIGIOUS BOOK COLLECTION WHICH IS HOUSED IN THE LIBRARY AND ACCESSIBLE FOR RESEARCH.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE QUASI-ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE MAINTAINED AS LONG-TERM INVESTMENTS, PROVIDING INTERGENERATIONAL EQUITY FOR COLLEGE SPENDING. INCOME FROM THE PERMANENT FUNDS IS USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAPS: -342542. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS: -10144.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF INTEREST RATE SWAPS: -342542. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS: -10144. SCHOLARSHIPS: -4674022.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: MOUNT ALOYSIUS COLLEGE PUBLISHES ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY ON THE INSIDE BACK COVER OF ITS STUDENT CATALOG.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: THE COLLEGE RECEIVES VARIOUS FEDERAL GRANTS DIRECTLY FROM THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, INCLUDING SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATION OPPORTUNITY GRANTS, COLLEGE WORK-STUDY FUNDING, AND PELL GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO RECEIVES GRANTS FROM THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, THE MOST SIGNIFICANT OF WHICH IS THE INSTITUTIONAL ASSISTANCE GRANT.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: CASH SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR TUITION FEES
SUPPLEMENTAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY GRANT AWARDED TO STUDENTS FOR TUITION AND FEES
COLLEGE WORK STUDY GRANT AWARDED TO STUDENTS FOR TUITION AND FEES
OTHER GRANTS (SEWING SEEDS OF HOPE, MERCY MISSION, UW NEW CHOICES) FOR TUITION AND FEES

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: THE COLLEGE HAS A FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WHICH FOLLOWS THE FEDERAL LAWS REGARDING STUDENT FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING AID AND COLLEGE GRANTS. STUDENT GRANTS ARE POSTED TO STUDENT BILLING ACCOUNTS AS A PART OF THEIR FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. THE COLLEGE DOES NOT PROVIDE GRANTS TO ANY OTHER ORGANIZATIONS OR INDIVIDUALS.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Sister Mary Ann Dillon receives a housing allowance as part of her employment agreement. Sister Mary Ann Dillon does not receive compensation - the stipends for her are paid directly to the religious order (Sisters of Mercy).

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS INCL RENOVATION OF STUDENT UNION AND DORMITORITY CONST

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: ANN BALAZS IS A COMPANY OFFICER OF L. ROBERT KIMBALL & ASSOCIATES. L. ROBERT KIMBALL & ASSOCIATES PROVIDES ARCHITECTURAL AND ENGINEERING SERVICES TO THE COLLEGE ON AN ARM'S LENGTH BASIS.

KIM CRAIG IS THE PRESIDENT AND CEO OF FNB WEALTH MANAGEMENT. THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A CD ACCOUNT WITH MULTIPLE CERTIFICATES OF DEPOSIT AT FNB WEALTH MANAGEMENT. FEES PAID TO FNB WEALTH MANAGEMENT TOTALED $10,517 FOR THE FISCAL YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CONFERENCE FOR MERCY HIGHER EDUCATION IS A MEMBER OF MOUNT ALOYSIUS COLLEGE WHO HAS THE RIGHT OF FINAL APPROVAL OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR CERTAIN ACTIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MEMBER OF THE CORPORATION, THE CONFERENCE FOR MERCY HIGHER EDUCATION, HAS THE RIGHT OF FINAL APPROVAL OF ACTION OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF CERTAIN ITEMS INCLUDING APPOINTMENT OR REMOVAL OF THE PRESIDENT AND SELECTION OF MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE CHARTER, THE FORM 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO THE FILING WITH THE IRS. THE 990 IS FIRST REVIEWED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IN LATE NOVEMBER. AFTER THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEW, THE 990 IS POSTED TO A SECURE COLLEGE WEBSITE FOR REVIEW BY THE FULL BOARD PRIOR TO THE IRS FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Conflict of Interest policy is monitored and enforced on an annual basis. For the Board of Trustees, the Committee on Trustees ensures that each trustee has completed a conflict of interest form on an annual basis. The Committee on Trustees then reviews all forms for any identified conflicts of interest. Human Resources ensures that each key employee has completed a conflict of interest form on an annual basis. All key employee forms are reviewed by Human Resources for any identified conflicts of interest. Any potential conflicts are then dealt with on a case-by-case basis. Board trustees with an identified conflict of interest are expected to abstain from voting, and if determined by the Board, to withdrawal from the meeting.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND INCLUDES A DISCUSSION OF COMPARABLE SALARIES AS WELL AS CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION OF THE DELIBERATION AND DECISION. COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BY A COLLEGE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. COMPARABILITY DATA IS USED, AND CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION OF THE DELIBERATION AND DECISION TAKES PLACE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND POLICIES ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
NO COMPENSATION WAS PAID DIRECTLY BY THE COLLEGE TO THE PRESIDENT. THE STIPENDS FOR SR. MARY ANN DILLON ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE RELIGIOUS ORDER (SISTERS OF MERCY).

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: SPONSORSHIP OVERSIGHT FOR HIGHER ED INSTITUTIONS FOUNDED BY SISTERS OF MERCY
